Package serverGui

Class ServerMainController

java.lang.Object
serverGui.ServerMainController
public class ServerMainController extends Object
Main controller for the server-side GUI. Handles server startup, shutdown, and monthly report scheduling. Also updates the status label and manages connections to the database.

  • Constructor Details

    • ServerMainController

      public ServerMainController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the server GUI. Sets default values for input fields (server/db IPs and credentials), and configures the client connection table. This method runs automatically when the FXML view is loaded.

    • addClient

      public void addClient(String ip, String host, int id)
      Adds a client entry to the connection table. Removes any existing entries with the same IP/host or ID to avoid duplicates, and refreshes the table UI with the new entry.
      Parameters:
      ip - the IP address of the connected client
      host - the hostname of the connected client
      id - a unique identifier for the client (used for distinguishing entries)

    • updateClientStatus

      public void updateClientStatus(int id, String status)
      Updates a client's connection status in the UI table. Searches the client list by unique ID and changes the status text, then refreshes the table to reflect the change.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the client
      status - the updated status label ("Connected" or "Disconnected")

    • testGenerateReportsNow

      public void testGenerateReportsNow()
      Triggers a one-time manual report generation. This is useful for development and validation purposes, generating reports for a fixed date range (June 2025).
